arabicText: وَإِذْ قَالَ لُقْمَـٰنُ لِٱبْنِهِۦ وَهُوَ يَعِظُهُۥ يَـٰبُنَىَّ لَا تُشْرِكْ بِٱللَّهِ ۖ إِنَّ ٱلشِّرْكَ لَظُلْمٌ عَظِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	remember	when	Luqman	said	to	his	
son,	and	he	used	to	advise	him,	“O	my	son!	
Never	ascribe	anything	as	a	partner	to	
Allah;	indeed	ascribing	partners	to	Him	is	
a	tremendous	injustice.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	yād	karo	jab	Luqmān	ne	apne	bete	se	
kahā	aur	woh	nasiḥāt	kartā	thā	aey	mere	
bete	Allāh	kā	kisi	ko	sharik	na	karnā	be
shak	shirk	badā	zulm	hai.

arabicText: وَوَصَّيْنَا ٱلْإِنسَـٰنَ بِوَٰلِدَيْهِ حَمَلَتْهُ أُمُّهُۥ وَهْنًا عَلَىٰ وَهْنٍۢ وَفِصَـٰلُهُۥ فِى عَامَيْنِ أَنِ ٱشْكُرْ لِى وَلِوَٰلِدَيْكَ إِلَىَّ ٱلْمَصِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
And	We	ordained	upon	man	concerning	
his	parents;	his	mother	bore	him	
enduring	weakness	upon	weakness,	and	
his	suckling	is	up	to	two	years	–	therefore	
be	thankful	to	Me	and	to	your	parents;	
finally	towards	Me	is	the	return
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	ham	ne	āadmi	ko	us	ke	māñ	bāp	ke	
bare	meiñ	tākeed	farmāyi		us	ki	māñ	ne	
usey	pait	meiñ	rakhā	kamzori	par	
kamzori	jhelti	huyi	aur	us	kā	doodh	
chootnā	do	baras	meiñ	hai	ye	ke	ḥaq	mān	
merā	aur	apne	māñ	bāp	kā	āakhir	mujhi	
tak	āanā	hai.

arabicText: وَإِن جَـٰهَدَاكَ عَلَىٰٓ أَن تُشْرِكَ بِى مَا لَيْسَ لَكَ بِهِۦ عِلْمٌۭ فَلَا تُطِعْهُمَا ۖ وَصَاحِبْهُمَا فِى ٱلدُّنْيَا مَعْرُوفًۭا ۖ وَٱتَّبِعْ سَبِيلَ مَنْ أَنَابَ إِلَىَّ ۚ ثُمَّ إِلَىَّ مَرْجِعُكُمْ فَأُنَبِّئُكُم بِمَا كُنتُمْ تَعْمَلُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	they	force	you,	that	you	ascribe	a	
partner	to	Me	a	thing	concerning	which	
you	do	not	have	knowledge	–	so	do	not	
obey	them	and	support	them	well	in	the	
world;	and	follow	the	path	of	one	who	has	
inclined	towards	Me;	then	towards	Me	
only	is	your	return,	and	I	shall	tell	you	
what	you	used	to	do
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	woh	donoñ	tujh	se	koshish	kareñ	
ke	merā	sharik	thahrāyeñ	aisi	chiz	ko	jis	
kā	tujhe	'ilm	nahiñ	to	un	kā	kahnā	nā	mān	
aur	duniyā	meiñ	achchi	ṭaraḥ	un	kā	sāth	
de	aur	us	ki	rāh	chal	jo	meri	ṭaraf	ruju'	
lāyā	fir	meri	hi	ṭaraf	tumheñ	fir	āanā	hai	
to	meiñ	batā	duñgā	jo	tum	karte	the.

arabicText: يَـٰبُنَىَّ إِنَّهَآ إِن تَكُ مِثْقَالَ حَبَّةٍۢ مِّنْ خَرْدَلٍۢ فَتَكُن فِى صَخْرَةٍ أَوْ فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ أَوْ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ يَأْتِ بِهَا ٱللَّهُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَطِيفٌ خَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	son!	If	the	evil	deed	is	equal	to	the	
weight	of	a	mustard-seed,	and	even	if	it	is	
in	a	rock,	or	in	the	heavens,	or	wherever	in	the	earth,	Allah	will	bring	it	forth;	indeed	Allah	
knows	all	the	minutest	things,	the	All	Aware.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	mere	bete	burāyi	agar	rāyi	ke	dāne	barābar	ho	phir	woh	paththar	ki	chattān	meiñ	yā	
āasmānoñ	meiñ	yā	zameen	meiñ	kahiñ	ho	Allāh	usey	le	āaye	ga	be-shak	Allāh	har	bāriki	kā	
jānne	wālā	khabardār	hai.

arabicText: يَـٰبُنَىَّ أَقِمِ ٱلصَّلَوٰةَ وَأْمُرْ بِٱلْمَعْرُوفِ وَٱنْهَ عَنِ ٱلْمُنكَرِ وَٱصْبِرْ عَلَىٰ مَآ أَصَابَكَ ۖ إِنَّ ذَٰلِكَ مِنْ عَزْمِ ٱلْأُمُورِ
englishTranslationText:
“O	my	son!	Keep	the	prayer	established,	and	enjoin	goodness	and	forbid	from	evil,	and	be	
patient	upon	the	calamity	that	befalls	you;	indeed	these	are	acts	of	great	courage.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ae	mere	bete	Namāz	barpā	rakh	aur	achchi	bāt	kā	ḥukm	de	aur	buri	bāt	se	mana'	kar	aur	jo	
uftād	(musibat)	tujh	par	pade	us	par	sabr	kar	be-shak	ye	himmat	ke	kām	haiñ.

arabicText: وَلَا تُصَعِّرْ خَدَّكَ لِلنَّاسِ وَلَا تَمْشِ فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مَرَحًا ۖ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ لَا يُحِبُّ كُلَّ مُخْتَالٍۢ فَخُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
“And	do	not	contort	your	cheek	while	talking	to	anyone,	nor	boastfully	walk	upon	the	earth;	
indeed	Allah	does	not	like	any	boastful,	haughty	person.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	kisi	se	bāt	karne	meiñ	apnā	rukhsāra	kaj	na	kar	aur	zameen	meiñ	itrātā	na	chal	be-shak	
Allāh	ko	nahiñ	bhātā	koyi	itrātā	fakhr	kartā.

arabicText: وَٱقْصِدْ فِى مَشْيِكَ وَٱغْضُضْ مِن صَوْتِكَ ۚ إِنَّ أَنكَرَ ٱلْأَصْوَٰتِ لَصَوْتُ ٱلْحَمِيرِ
englishTranslationText: “And	walk	moderately	and	soften	your	voice;	indeed	the	worst	voice	is	the	voice	of	the	donkey.”
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	miyāna	chāl	chal	aur	apni	āawāz	kuch	past	kar	be-shak	sab	āawāzoñ	meiñ	buri	āawāz	
gadhe	ki	āawāz.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَوْا۟ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَخَّرَ لَكُم مَّا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ وَأَسْبَغَ عَلَيْكُمْ نِعَمَهُۥ ظَـٰهِرَةًۭ وَبَاطِنَةًۭ ۗ وَمِنَ ٱلنَّاسِ مَن يُجَـٰدِلُ فِى ٱللَّهِ بِغَيْرِ عِلْمٍۢ وَلَا هُدًۭى وَلَا كِتَـٰبٍۢ مُّنِيرٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	that	Allah	has	made	all	
whatever	is	in	the	heavens	and	all	
whatever	is	in	the	earth,	subservient	for	
you	and	bestowed	His	favours	upon	you	
in	full,	both	visible	and	hidden?	And	some	
men	argue	regarding	Allah,	with	neither	
knowledge,	nor	guidance,	nor	a	clear	
Book!
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tum	ne	na	dekhā	ke	Allāh	ne	tumhāre	
liye	kām	meiñ	lagāye	jo	kuch	āsmānoñ	aur	
zameen	meiñ	haiñ	aur	tumheñ	bhar	por	
diñ	apni	ne'amateñ	zāhir	aur	chupi	aur	
b'aze	āadmi	Allāh	ke	bare	meiñ	jhagadte	
haiñ	yoñ	ke	na	'ilm	na	'aql	na	koyi	roshan	
kitāb.

arabicText: وَإِذَا قِيلَ لَهُمُ ٱتَّبِعُوا۟ مَآ أَنزَلَ ٱللَّهُ قَالُوا۟ بَلْ نَتَّبِعُ مَا وَجَدْنَا عَلَيْهِ ءَابَآءَنَآ ۚ أَوَلَوْ كَانَ ٱلشَّيْطَـٰنُ يَدْعُوهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابِ ٱلسَّعِيرِ
englishTranslationText:
And	when	it	is	said	to	them,	“Follow	what	
Allah	has	sent	down”,	they	say,	“On	the	
contrary,	we	shall	only	follow	that	upon	
which	we	found	our	forefathers”;	even	if	
the	devil	was	calling	them	to	the	
punishment	of	hell?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	se	kahā	jāye	us	ki	pairwi	karo	
jo	Allāh	ne	utārā	to	kahte	haiñ	balke	ham	
to	us	ki	pairwi	kareñ	ge	jis	par	ham	ne	
apne	bāp	dada	ko	pāyā	kyā	agarche	
shaiṭān	un	ko	ázāb-e-dozakh	ki	ṭaraf	
bulātā	ho.

arabicText: ۞ وَمَن يُسْلِمْ وَجْهَهُۥٓ إِلَى ٱللَّهِ وَهُوَ مُحْسِنٌۭ فَقَدِ ٱسْتَمْسَكَ بِٱلْعُرْوَةِ ٱلْوُثْقَىٰ ۗ وَإِلَى ٱللَّهِ عَـٰقِبَةُ ٱلْأُمُورِ
englishTranslationText:
Whoever	submits	his	face	to	Allah	and	is	
righteous	–	so	he	has	indeed	grasped	the	
firm	knot;	and	towards	Allah	only	is	the	
culmination	of	all	things.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	apnā	moñh	Allāh	ki	ṭaraf	jhukā	de	
aur	ho	neko	kār	to	be-shak	us	ne	mazboṭ	
girah	thāmi	aur	Allāh	hi	ki	ṭaraf	hai	sab	
kāmoñ	ki	intehā.

arabicText: وَمَن كَفَرَ فَلَا يَحْزُنكَ كُفْرُهُۥٓ ۚ إِلَيْنَا مَرْجِعُهُمْ فَنُنَبِّئُهُم بِمَا عَمِلُوٓا۟ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌۢ بِذَاتِ ٱلصُّدُورِ
englishTranslationText:
And	whoever	disbelieves	–	then	do	not	be	
aggrieved	by	his	disbelief	(O	dear	Prophet	
Muhammad	-	peace	and	blessings	be	upon	
him);	they	have	to	return	to	Us,	and	We	
will	inform	them	what	they	were	doing;	
indeed	Allah	knows	what	lies	within	the	
hearts.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jo	kufr	kare	to	tum	us	ke	kufr	se	gham	
na	khāo	unheñ	hamāri	hi	ṭaraf	phirnā	hai	
ham	unheñ	batā	deñ	ge	jo	karte	the	be
shak	Allāh	diloñ	ki	bāt	jāntā	hai.

arabicText: نُمَتِّعُهُمْ قَلِيلًۭا ثُمَّ نَضْطَرُّهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابٍ غَلِيظٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	shall	give	them	some	usage,	then	
making	them	helpless	take	them	towards	
a	severe	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	unheñ	kuch	baratne	deñ	ge	phir	
unheñ	be-bas	kar	ke	sakht	'aƶāb	ki	ṭaraf	le	
jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: نُمَتِّعُهُمْ قَلِيلًۭا ثُمَّ نَضْطَرُّهُمْ إِلَىٰ عَذَابٍ غَلِيظٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
We	shall	give	them	some	usage,	then	
making	them	helpless	take	them	towards	
a	severe	punishment.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ham	unheñ	kuch	baratne	deñ	ge	phir	
unheñ	be-bas	kar	ke	sakht	'aƶāb	ki	ṭaraf	le	
jāyeñ	ge.

arabicText: وَلَئِن سَأَلْتَهُم مَّنْ خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضَ لَيَقُولُنَّ ٱللَّهُ ۚ قُلِ ٱلْحَمْدُ لِلَّهِ ۚ بَلْ أَكْثَرُهُمْ لَا يَعْلَمُونَ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	you	ask	them,	“Who	created	the	heavens	and	the	earth?”	-	they	will	surely	answer,	
“Allah”;	proclaim,	“All	Praise	is	to	Allah”;	in	fact	most	of	them	do	not	know.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	tum	un	se	pooñcho	kis	ne	banāye	
āasmān	aur	zameen	to	zaror	kaheñ	ge	
Allāh	ne	tum	farmāo	sab	khobiyāñ	Allāh	
ko	balke	un	meiñ	aksar	jānte	nahiñ.

arabicText: لِلَّهِ مَا فِى ٱلسَّمَـٰوَٰتِ وَٱلْأَرْضِ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْغَنِىُّ ٱلْحَمِيدُ
englishTranslationText:
To	Allah	only	belongs	whatsoever	is	in	the	heavens	and	in	the	earth;	indeed	Allah	only	is	the	
Absolute,	the	Most	Praiseworthy.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Allāh	hi	kā	hai	jo	kuch	āsmānoñ	aur	zameen	meiñ	hai	be-shak	Allāh	hi	be-niyāz	hai	sab	
khoobiyoñ	sarāhā.

arabicText: وَلَوْ أَنَّمَا فِى ٱلْأَرْضِ مِن شَجَرَةٍ أَقْلَـٰمٌۭ وَٱلْبَحْرُ يَمُدُّهُۥ مِنۢ بَعْدِهِۦ سَبْعَةُ أَبْحُرٍۢ مَّا نَفِدَتْ كَلِمَـٰتُ ٱللَّهِ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَزِيزٌ حَكِيمٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	all	the	trees	in	the	earth	were	pens,	and	the	seas	were	its	ink,	with	seven	more	seas	to	
back	it	up	-	the	Words	of	Allah	will	not	finish;	indeed	Allah	is	Almighty,	Wise.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	agar	zameen	meiñ	jitney	ped	haiñ	sab	qalameñ	ho	jāyeñ	aur	samandar	us	ki	siyāhi	ho	us	ke	
peeche	sāt	samandar	aur	to	Allāh	ki	bāteñ	khatm	na	hoñ	gi	be-shak	Allāh	'Izzat-o-Hikmat	wālā	
hai.

arabicText: مَّا خَلْقُكُمْ وَلَا بَعْثُكُمْ إِلَّا كَنَفْسٍۢ وَٰحِدَةٍ ۗ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ سَمِيعٌۢ بَصِيرٌ
englishTranslationText:
Creating	you	all	and	raising	you	from	the	dead	are	like	that	of	one	soul	*;	indeed	Allah	is	All	
Hearing,	All	Knowing.	(He	can	create	you	slowly	or	all	at	once).
romanUrduTranslationText:
Tum	sab	kā	paidā	karnā	aur	Qayāmat	meiñ	uthānā	aisā	hi	hai	jaisā	aik	jān	kā	be-shak	Allāh	
sunta	dekhtā	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱللَّهَ يُولِجُ ٱلَّيْلَ فِى ٱلنَّهَارِ وَيُولِجُ ٱلنَّهَارَ فِى ٱلَّيْلِ وَسَخَّرَ ٱلشَّمْسَ وَٱلْقَمَرَ كُلٌّۭ يَجْرِىٓ إِلَىٰٓ أَجَلٍۢ مُّسَمًّۭى وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ بِمَا تَعْمَلُونَ خَبِيرٌۭ
englishTranslationText:
O	listener,	did	you	not	see	that	Allah	
brings	the	night	in	a	part	of	the	day	and	
brings	the	day	in	a	part	of	the	night,	and	
that	He	has	subjected	the	sun	and	the	
moon	-	each	one	runs	for	its	fixed	term	-	
and	that	Allah	is	Well	Aware	of	your	
deeds?
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	sunne	wāle	kyā	tu	ne	na	dekhā	ke	
Allāh	Rāt	lātā	hai	Din	ke	ḥisse	meiñ	aur	
Din	kartā	hai	Rāt	ke	ḥisse	meiñ	aur	us	ne	
Sooraj	aur	Chānd	kām	meiñ	lagāye	har	aik	
aik	muqarrar	mi'āad	tak	chaltā	hai	aur	ye	
ke	Allāh	tumhāre	kāmoñ	se	khabardār	
hai.

arabicText: ذَٰلِكَ بِأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْحَقُّ وَأَنَّ مَا يَدْعُونَ مِن دُونِهِ ٱلْبَـٰطِلُ وَأَنَّ ٱللَّهَ هُوَ ٱلْعَلِىُّ ٱلْكَبِيرُ
englishTranslationText:
This	is	because	only	Allah	is	the	Truth,	
and	all	that	they	worship	besides	Him	are	
falsehood,	and	because	only	Allah	is	the	
Supreme,	the	Great.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Ye	is	liye	ke	Allāh	hi	ḥaq	hai	aur	us	ke	
siwā	jin	ko	pojte	haiñ	sab	bāṭil	haiñ	aur	is	
liye	ke	Allāh	hi	baland	badāyi	wālā	hai.

arabicText: أَلَمْ تَرَ أَنَّ ٱلْفُلْكَ تَجْرِى فِى ٱلْبَحْرِ بِنِعْمَتِ ٱللَّهِ لِيُرِيَكُم مِّنْ ءَايَـٰتِهِۦٓ ۚ إِنَّ فِى ذَٰلِكَ لَـَٔايَـٰتٍۢ لِّكُلِّ صَبَّارٍۢ شَكُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
Did	you	not	see	that	the	ship	sails	on	the	
sea	by	Allah’s	grace,	so	that	He	may	show	
you	some	of	His	signs?	Indeed	in	this	are	
signs	for	every	greatly	enduring,	grateful	
person.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Kyā	tu	ne	na	dikhā	ke	kashti	dariyā	meiñ	
chalti	hai	Allāh	ke	fazl	se	take	tumheñ	
woh	apni	kuch	nishāniyāñ	dikhāye	be
shak	is	meiñ	nishāniyāñ	haiñ	har	bade	
sabr	karne	wāle	shukr	guzār	ko

arabicText: وَإِذَا غَشِيَهُم مَّوْجٌۭ كَٱلظُّلَلِ دَعَوُا۟ ٱللَّهَ مُخْلِصِينَ لَهُ ٱلدِّينَ فَلَمَّا نَجَّىٰهُمْ إِلَى ٱلْبَرِّ فَمِنْهُم مُّقْتَصِدٌۭ ۚ وَمَا يَجْحَدُ بِـَٔايَـٰتِنَآ إِلَّا كُلُّ خَتَّارٍۢ كَفُورٍۢ
englishTranslationText:
And	if	a	wave	comes	upon	them	like	
mountains,	they	pray	to	Allah	believing	
purely	in	Him;	then	when	He	brings	them	
safely	to	land,	some	of	them	remain	upon	
justice;	and	none	will	deny	Our	signs	
except	an	extremely	unfaithful,	ungrateful	
person.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aur	jab	un	par	āa	padti	hai	koi	mauj	
pahādoñ	ki	ṭaraḥ	to	Allāh	ko	pukārte	haiñ	
nire	usi	par	'aqida	rakhte	huye	phir	jab	
unheñ	khushki	ki	ṭaraf	bachā	lātā	hai	to	
un	meiñ	koi	e'atidāl	par	rahtā	hai	aur	
hamāri	āayatoñ	kā	inkār	na	kare	ga	magar	
har	badā	be-wafā	nā-shukrā.

arabicText: يَـٰٓأَيُّهَا ٱلنَّاسُ ٱتَّقُوا۟ رَبَّكُمْ وَٱخْشَوْا۟ يَوْمًۭا لَّا يَجْزِى وَالِدٌ عَن وَلَدِهِۦ وَلَا مَوْلُودٌ هُوَ جَازٍ عَن وَالِدِهِۦ شَيْـًٔا ۚ إِنَّ وَعْدَ ٱللَّهِ حَقٌّۭ ۖ فَلَا تَغُرَّنَّكُمُ ٱلْحَيَوٰةُ ٱلدُّنْيَا وَلَا يَغُرَّنَّكُم بِٱللَّهِ ٱلْغَرُورُ
englishTranslationText:
O	mankind!	Fear	your	Lord,	and	fear	the	
Day	in	which	no	father	will	benefit	his	
child;	nor	will	any	good	child	be	of	any	
benefit	to	the	father;	indeed	Allah’s	
promise	is	true;	so	never	may	the	worldly	
life	deceive	you;	and	never	may	the	great	cheat	deceive	you	in	respect	of	Allah’s	commands.
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ	apne	Rab	se	daro	aur	us	din	kā	
khauf	karo	jis	meiñ	koi	bāp	apne	bachche	
ke	kām	na	āaye	gā	aur	na	koi	kāmi	bachchā	apne	bāp	ko	kuch	nafa'	de	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	
sachchā	hai	to	har	giz	tumheñ	dhokā	na	de	duniyā	ki	zindagi	aur	har	giz	tumheñ	Allāh	ke	ḥilm	
par	dhokā	na	de	woh	badā	farebi.

arabicText: إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عِندَهُۥ عِلْمُ ٱلسَّاعَةِ وَيُنَزِّلُ ٱلْغَيْثَ وَيَعْلَمُ مَا فِى ٱلْأَرْحَامِ ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِى نَفْسٌۭ مَّاذَا تَكْسِبُ غَدًۭا ۖ وَمَا تَدْرِى نَفْسٌۢ بِأَىِّ أَرْضٍۢ تَمُوتُ ۚ إِنَّ ٱللَّهَ عَلِيمٌ خَبِيرٌۢ
englishTranslationText:
Indeed	Allah	has	the	knowledge	of	the	Last	Day!	And	He	sends	down	the	rain;	and	He	knows	all	
what	is	in	the	mothers’	wombs;	and	no	soul	knows	what	it	will	earn	tomorrow;	and	no	soul	
knows	the	place	where	it	will	die;	indeed	Allah	is	the	All	Knowing,	the	Informer.	(He	may	reveal	
the	knowledge	to	whomever	He	wills.)
romanUrduTranslationText:
Aey	logoñ	apne	Rab	se	daro	aur	us	din	kā	
khauf	karo	jis	meiñ	koi	bāp	apne	bachche	
ke	kām	na	āaye	gā	aur	na	koi	kāmi	bachchā	apne	bāp	ko	kuch	nafa'	de	be-shak	Allāh	kā	w'ada	
Be-shak	Allāh	ke	pās	hai	qiyāmat	kā	'ilm	aur	utārtā	hai	miñh	aur	jāntā	hai	jo	kuch	māoñ	ke	pet	
meiñ	hai	aur	koi	jān	nahiñ	jānti	ke	kal	kyā	kamāye	gi	aur	koi	jān	nahiñ	jānti	ke	kis	zameen	meiñ	
mare	gi	be-shak	Allāh	jānne	wālā	batāne	wālā	hai.
